Package maze

Class Maze

java.lang.Object
maze.Maze
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph, InterfaceableMaze
public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph, InterfaceableMaze
Implements the InterfaceableMaze and Graph interfaces.

  • Constructor Details

    • Maze

      public Maze()
      Constructs an empty maze with null dimensions. The new maze is not opened.

    • Maze

      public Maze​(int height, int width) throws UnexpectedBoxTypeException
      Constructs a new maze with given dimensions. The maze is considered opened.
      Parameters:
      height - height of the new maze.
      width - width of the new maze.
      Throws:
      UnexpectedBoxTypeException - if type does not match any.

    • Maze

      public Maze​(Box[][] boxes)
      Constructs a maze from a matrix of boxes.
      Parameters:
      boxes - a matrix of boxes.

  • Method Details

    • newMaze

      public void newMaze​(int height, int width, int[] args) throws UnexpectedBoxTypeException, InvalidBoxArgumentsException
      Creates a new maze without invoking constructor. This method effectively opens the maze.
      Specified by:
      newMaze in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      height - height of the new maze.
      width - width of the new maze.
      args - type of the boxes to fill the maze with.
      Throws:
      UnexpectedBoxTypeException - if the given box type does not match with any.
      InvalidBoxArgumentsException - if the given arguments could not be parsed by the Box constructor.

    • newMaze

      public void newMaze​(Box[][] boxes)
      Description copied from interface: InterfaceableMaze
      Creates a new maze out of a matrix of boxes.
      Specified by:
      newMaze in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      boxes - a matrix of boxes from which the maze is built.

    • read

      public void read​(java.io.InputStream in) throws java.io.IOException, ReadingException
      Reads a new maze from a given input stream. The stream, typically a file stream, shall fit with a correct format. Boxes are read one after another, each separated by integer value 255. Each box must be described as follows : box_type x y z flags required_args. It effecively opens the maze.
      Specified by:
      read in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      in - input stream to be read.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
      ReadingException - if the method was unable to parse the stream correctly (bad format for example)

      Specified by:

    • display

      public void display​(java.io.PrintStream out)
      Displays the maze in a given output stream. The method adds coordinates up to 9, then it cycles. If some flags are to display, rules of priority are as follow, from highest to least priority : BOX_START, BOX_END, BOX_MARKED.
      Specified by:
      display in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      out - output stream to be written.

    • getVertices

      public java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> getVertices()
      Description copied from interface: Graph
      Returns a list of all the vertices.
      Specified by:
      getVertices in interface Graph
      Returns:
      A list of all the vertices.

    • getSuccessors

      public java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> getSuccessors​(Vertex vertex)
      Returns a list of the successors of vertex. It only returns boxes that are not distant and directly adjacent (up to four directions).
      Specified by:
      getSuccessors in interface Graph
      Parameters:
      vertex - origin vertex.
      Returns:
      A list of the successors of vertex.

    • distance

      public int distance​(Vertex src, Vertex dst)
      Returns the distance between two vertices. The distance between two boxes is defined as the sum of their practicabilities, with conventions : null is distant, distant + anything = distant.
      Specified by:
      distance in interface Graph
      Parameters:
      src - First vertex.
      dst - Second vertex.
      Returns:
      The distance from src to dst.

      Parameters:
      flag - flag to be searched.
      Returns:

    • addFlag

      public void addFlag​(int x, int y, BoxFlag flag) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, NullBoxException
      Adds a flag to a box. If the given flag is BOX_START, the method makes a call to setRoot, so that it takes care of root management.
      Specified by:
      addFlag in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the box.
      y - Y coordinate of the box.
      flag - flag to be added.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of the maze dimensions.
      NullBoxException - if there is no box to the given coordinates.

    • remFlag

      public void remFlag​(int x, int y, BoxFlag flag) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, NullBoxException
      Removes a flag from a box. If it removes the root, hasRoot is modified.
      Specified by:
      remFlag in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the box.
      y - Y coordinate of the box.
      flag - flag to be removed.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of the maze dimensions.
      NullBoxException - if there is no box to the given coordinates.

    • getRoot

      public Vertex getRoot()
      Description copied from interface: InterfaceableMaze
      Returns the current root.
      Specified by:
      getRoot in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Returns:
      The root of the maze. If there is none, null is returned.

    • setRoot

      public boolean setRoot​(int x, int y) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, NullBoxException
      Description copied from interface: InterfaceableMaze
      Adds a BOX_START flag to a box. Only one box in the maze can be flagged as root at a time.
      Specified by:
      setRoot in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the box.
      y - Y coordinate of the box.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of the maze dimensions.
      NullBoxException - if there is no box to the given coordinates.

      Description copied from interface: InterfaceableMaze

      Specified by:

    • addRow

      public void addRow​(int pos, int[] args) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, UnexpectedBoxTypeException, InvalidBoxArgumentsException
      Description copied from interface: InterfaceableMaze
      Adds a row.
      Specified by:
      addRow in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      pos - position of the new row.
      args - box type to fill the row with.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if pos exceeds the height of the maze.
      UnexpectedBoxTypeException - if the given box type does not match any.
      InvalidBoxArgumentsException - if the given arguments could not be parsed by the Box constructor.

    • addBox

      public void addBox​(int[] args) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, UnexpectedBoxTypeException, InvalidBoxArgumentsException
      Description copied from interface: InterfaceableMaze
      Adds a new box with given type and arguments.
      Specified by:
      addBox in interface InterfaceableMaze
      Parameters:
      args - an array of arguments to provide the constructor with.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the first two arguments given, corresponding to x and y, are out of maze borders.
      UnexpectedBoxTypeException - if the given box type does not match any.
      InvalidBoxArgumentsException - if the given arguments could not be parsed by the Box constructor.
